ThingDef.label: apple tree
ThingDef.description: A tree with little green apples on it.

ThingDef.label: orange tree
ThingDef.description: A tree with bitter oranges on it. All orange trees are middle-sized, evergreen trees. An orange tree's leaves are ovate, acute, aqnd at the base of the petiole, are winged. Orange leaves, orange flours, and wood of the tree are extensively used in perfumery and artisinal production. The tree's wood is fine-grained, compacted, and susceptible of a high polish.

ThingDef.label: lemon tree
ThingDef.description: A thorny tree with lemons on it. It needs warm temperatures to grow.

ThingDef.label: lime tree
ThingDef.description: A tree with limes on it. Akin to the lemon, its acidic fruit is smaller than the lemon and bares a characteristic flavor.

ThingDef.label: citron tree
ThingDef.description: A tree with citrons on it. Originally native to Old Earth's Himalayan valleys and Old Earth's Deccan Zone on the Indian sub-continent, citron trees were spread west in classical antiquity by the ancient, human conqueror named Alexander the Great.
